channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump and His Allies Adapt to a New Role: Fighting for Attention
item.description: In the days since President Biden ended his re-election bid and passed the torch to Vice President Kamala Harris, Donald Trump’s campaign has been crowded out of the headlines.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Netanyahu Meets With Biden to Discuss the War in Gaza
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, a day after addressing Congress, met on Thursday with President Biden at the White House. Both leaders offered polite words at a fraught moment in their relationship with the future of the Middle East on the line.

item.title: LVMH says its wine business took a 12% hit because people are too sad to buy champagne
item.description: LVMH CFO anticipates sales volumes will be “less bad” in the second half of the year.

item.title: Park Fire Balloons in California as Smoke Spreads in Northwest and Canada
item.description: The authorities arrested a man believed to have started the fire in Northern California, which has burned over 70,000 acres. A spate of wildfires prompted air quality warnings.

item.title: Gaza’s Death Toll Was Largely Accurate in Early Days of War, Study Finds
item.description: Though the war has clearly devastated the civilian population, the credibility of the Gazan Health Ministry’s toll has been a subject of debate.

item.title: Chipotle CEO says ‘generous portions’ will become standard after people blasted its skimpy serving sizes on social media
item.description: Brian Niccol said roughly 10% of Chipotle’s restaurants are outliers in terms of portion sizes.

item.title: Harris Narrows Gap Against Trump, Times/Siena Poll Finds
item.description: In a survey taken after President Biden stepped aside, Donald Trump and Kamala Harris are locked in a tight race separated by a single percentage point among likely voters.

item.title: Israeli Officials Retrieve the Bodies of 5 Hostages From Gaza
item.description: The military said that the bodies had been found in the Khan Younis area and that intelligence, including information from detained Palestinian militants, had led its forces to them.

item.title: The ultrarich are scooping up mansions while almost no one else can afford a typical home
item.description: Luxury-home prices rose more than twice as fast as non-luxury homes, and still their sales jumped compared to typical homes, according to Redfin.

item.title: Kamala Harris’s Fund-Raising Machine Cranks Into High Gear
item.description: Given weeks instead of years to cultivate donors, the vice president’s allies are armed with a new logo and burning up the phones.

item.title: Typhoon Gaemi Reaches China as Cargo Ship Sinks Off Taiwan
item.description: The storm, weaker but still dangerous, made landfall just before 8 p.m. local time. Six sailors were still missing after a cargo ship sank near Taiwan.

item.title: The 10 best prepaid debit cards you can get without a credit score
item.description: No checking account? No problem. These prepaid debit cards let you add funds and swipe to pay without a ton of fees.

item.title: Newsom Orders California Officials to Remove Homeless Encampments
item.description: The directive from Gov. Gavin Newsom is the nation’s most sweeping response to a Supreme Court decision last month that gave local leaders greater authority to remove homeless campers.

item.title: Martin S. Indyk, Diplomat Who Sought Middle East Peace, Dies at 73
item.description: As ambassador to Israel in the Clinton administration and as a special envoy under Barack Obama, he was skeptical of Israeli settlements.

item.title: Biles, Osaka, Richardson Olympic comebacks highlight issues facing people like them: ‘We’re still asking a lot of Black women athletes’
item.description: They've all bounced back to the world's biggest stage while displaying different levels of vulnerability.
